basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Daniel Blessing. A teamwork-oriented data scientist with proven analytical and critical thinking skills, exemplified by a history of academic success. Experience in data science, explicitly recognizing business and data requirements, and presenting insightful reports to other professionals. As shown in my projects, I have expanded my skills to proficiency in Javascript and full-stack technologies like React, Firebase, and Solidity.

projects.title: Deep Learning USF Practicum at Stanford
projects.description: Utilized deep neural networks and computer vision models like Unet for synthetic generation of Gadolinium-enhanced MRI images.

projects.title: Predicting League of Legends Matches with Machine Learning
projects.description: For my data mining class, I lead a group to successfully predict the outcome of professional League of Legends matches after 10 minutes with a 66% accuracy using GaussianNB with Naive priors [0.5,0.5] priors. I tested over 10 ML Algorithms, including Random Forest, QDA, and KNeighbors. Also, I used popular data science libraries like Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn.

projects.title: Blackjack on the Blockchain
projects.description: Won an Ethereum hackathon prize leading a five-person team bringing blackjack to the blockchain. Afterward, I developed the frontend, backend, and smart contracts for a fully-featured blackjack MVP on Ethereum. The front end is coded in Typescript, Tailwind, and React. I coded the backend in Typescript with serverless functions and the smart contracts in Solidity. I integrated Chainlink VRF for on-chain randomness. The code is on my GitHub, and I deployed the MVP to Vercel.

experience.company: B.S. in Applied Mathematics and Statistics (GPA 3.84/4) B.S. in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering
experience.title: The Johns Hopkins University
